snippet: Pearl of Hope was shut down after the Paris Prosecutor’s office charged its two senior leaders with using charity deliveries as a front to funnel funds to jihadists.
abstract: French Islamic charity Pearl of Hope is shut down and its leaders, Nabil Ouerfelli and Yasmine Znaidi, are charged with financing terrorism by channeling funds to jihadists in Syria; group, which did some actual charity work, is one of several in Europe suspected of links to terrorist groups and arrests highlight often blurred line between legitimate aid organizations and those that aid terrorists.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and MAÏA de la BAUME

lead_paragraph: Pearl of Hope was shut down after the Paris Prosecutor’s office charged its two senior leaders with using charity deliveries as a front to funnel funds to jihadists.

headline.main: Charity in France Is Accused of Being a Front for Financing Terrorism in Syria
headline.print_headline: Charity in France Is Accused of Being a Front for Financing Terrorism in Syria
